physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Normal neurological examination. Normal MRI and CT findings.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: At 10.5 months, head circumference was 50th percentile; mild ptosis and midface hypoplasia were noted.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Severe craniosynostosis on CT scans, with high intracranial pressure. Optic nerve sheaths dilated.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Head circumference showed no growth from the previous measure taken 10 months earlier.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Visual loss detected; severe swelling and papilledema noted.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Follow-up CT scans revealed increasing severity in craniosynostosis.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: No papilledema postoperatively; normal macula, vessels, and periphery.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Postoperative follow-up showed improvement in visual function.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Refer to craniofacial clinic due to papilledema.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Head circumference decreased to 50th percentile at age 6 years.

physical_examinations.relevant_findings: Normal head shape and open sutures confirmed by CT scans.
physical_examinations.changes_over_time: Development of anterior fontanelle bulge later noted.
